Title: THE EVENING AND THE MORNING
Author: Ken Follett
Description: In a prequel to “The Pillars of the Earth,” a boatbuilder, a Norman noblewoman and a monk live in England under attack by the Welsh and the Vikings.

Title: VINCE FLYNN: TOTAL POWER
Author: Kyle Mills
Description: When America’s power grid is shut down, Mitch Rapp goes after a cyber terrorist.

Title: TROUBLED BLOOD
Author: Robert Galbraith
Description: The fifth book in the Cormoran Strike series. A decades-old cold case might be connected to a serial killer; by J.K. Rowling, writing pseudonymously.

Title: TO SLEEP IN A SEA OF STARS
Author: Christopher Paolini
Description: Kira Navárez might be the only one who can save the Earth and its colonies from being destroyed.

Title: SHADOWS IN DEATH
Author: J.D. Robb
Description: The 51st book of the In Death series. A hitman with possible connections to Eve Dallas’s husband is seen near the scene of a crime.

Title: ANXIOUS PEOPLE
Author: Fredrik Backman
Description: A failed bank robber holds a group of strangers hostage at an apartment open house.

Title: THE VANISHING HALF
Author: Brit Bennett
Description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

Title: ALL THE DEVILS ARE HERE
Author: Louise Penny
Description: The 16th book in the Chief Inspector Gamache series. When his billionaire godfather is attacked, Gamache uncovers secrets hidden throughout Paris.

Title: PIRANESI
Author: Susanna Clarke
Description: Another world is revealed as a man called the Other asks Piranesi for help with research into a Great and Secret Knowledge.

Title: ONE BY ONE
Author: Ruth Ware
Description: An avalanche tests the bonds of coworkers from a London-based tech startup on a corporate retreat in the French Alps.

Title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
Author: Delia Owens
Description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

Title: THE HARBINGER II
Author: Jonathan Cahn
Description: Nouriel, Ana Goren and a figure known as "the prophet" return as revelations are unlocked.

Title: THE GUEST LIST
Author: Lucy Foley
Description: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

Title: SQUEEZE ME
Author: Carl Hiaasen
Description: A dead dowager, hungry pythons and occupants of the winter White House shake up the Palm Beach charity ball season.

Title: FIFTY WORDS FOR RAIN
Author: Asha Lemmie
Description: In 1940s Japan, an 8-year-old child of a married Japanese aristocrat and her African-American lover searches for her place in the world.

Title: RAGE
Author: Bob Woodward
Description: Based on 17 on-the-record interviews with President Trump and other reporting, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist details the president’s perspective on multiple crises.

Title: BLACKOUT
Author: Candace Owens
Description: The conservative commentator makes her case that Black Americans should part ways with the Democratic Party.

Title: DISLOYAL
Author: Michael Cohen
Description: An account of President Trump’s business empire, political campaign and presidential administration by his former personal attorney.

Title: KILLING CRAZY HORSE
Author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
Description: The ninth book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series focuses on conflicts with Native Americans.

Title: CASTE
Author: Isabel Wilkerson
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

Title: COMPROMISED
Author: Peter Strzok
Description: The former F.B.I. deputy assistant director of counterintelligence chronicles the investigation into Russia’s election interference and key moments from his career.

Title: UNTAMED
Author: Glennon Doyle
Description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

Title: SPEAKING FOR MYSELF
Author: Sarah Huckabee Sanders
Description: The former White House press secretary shares her perspective on her time working with President Trump

Title: EVERYTHING BEAUTIFUL IN ITS TIME
Author: Jenna Bush Hager
Description: Essays by the former first daughter and granddaughter celebrating the lives of her grandparents.

Title: LIVE FREE OR DIE
Author: Sean Hannity
Description: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election.

Title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH
Author: Mary L Trump
Description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.

Title: WHITE FRAGILITY
Author: Robin DiAngelo
Description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.

Title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
Author: Ibram X. Kendi
Description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

Title: MELANIA AND ME
Author: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff
Description: The former director of special events at Vogue describes parting ways with the First Lady after being made the scapegoat for inauguration finance irregularities.

Description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.

Author: Jon Meacham
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer creates a portrait of Representative John Lewis, the late civil rights leader and congressman for Georgia’s Fifth Congressional District.

Title: EAT A PEACH
Author: David Chang and Gabe Ulla
Description: A memoir by the chef and founder of Momofuku and the star of the Netflix series “Ugly Delicious.”

Title: THE INSTITUTE
Author: Stephen King
Description: Children with special talents are abducted and sequestered in an institution where the sinister staff seeks to extract their gifts through harsh methods.

Title: THEN SHE WAS GONE
Author: Lisa Jewell
Description: Ten years after her daughter disappears, a woman tries to get her life in order but remains haunted by unanswered questions.

Title: CILKA'S JOURNEY
Author: Heather Morris
Description: A 16-year-old, who sleeps with a concentration camp commandant in order to survive, is sentenced to a Siberian prison camp where she cares for the ill.

Title: LITTLE FIRES EVERYWHERE
Author: Celeste Ng
Description: An artist with a mysterious past and a disregard for the status quo upends a quiet town outside Cleveland.

Title: HOMEGOING
Author: Yaa Gyasi
Description: This Ghanaian-American writer’s first novel traces the lives in West Africa and America of seven generations of the descendants of two half sisters.

Title: I'M THINKING OF ENDING THINGS
Author: Iain Reid
Description: Jake drives his girlfriend who is on the verge of dangerous personal decisions through a snowstorm to the family farm.

Title: WHAT HAPPENS IN PARADISE
Author: Elin Hilderbrand
Description: In the sequel to "Winter in Paradise," Irene Steele visits the island of St. John to get to the bottom of the mysterious life and death of her husband.

Title: THIS TENDER LAND
Author: William Kent Krueger
Description: Four orphans escape a Minnesota school and encounter a cross-section of different people struggling during the Great Depression.

Title: THE MIDWIFE MURDERS
Author: James Patterson and Richard DiLallo
Description: A single mom teams up with an N.Y.P.D. detective to solve a case involving misdeeds at a university hospital.

Title: THE TESTAMENTS
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: In a sequel to “The Handmaid’s Tale,” old secrets bring three women together as the Republic of Gilead’s theocratic regime shows signs of decay.

Title: THE NIGHTINGALE
Author: Kristin Hannah
Description: Two sisters in World War II France: one struggling to survive in the countryside, the other joining the Resistance.

Title: THE HANDMAID'S TALE
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: In the Republic of Gilead's dystopian future, men and women perform the services assigned to them.

Title: LOVECRAFT COUNTRY
Author: Matt Ruff
Description: During the time of Jim Crow America, Atticus Turner’s father is held captive by the Order of the Ancient Dawn. The basis of the HBO series.

Title: THE NICKEL BOYS
Author: Colson Whitehead
Description: Two boys respond to horrors at a Jim Crow-era reform school in ways that impact them decades later.

Title: THE OVERSTORY
Author: Richard Powers
Description: Winner of the 2019 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. Nine people drawn to trees for different reasons fight for the last of the remaining acres of virgin forest.

Title: WHITE FRAGILITY
Author: Robin DiAngelo
Description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.

Title: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE
Author: Ijeoma Oluo
Description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.

Title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
Author: Bessel van der Kolk
Description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

Title: JUST MERCY
Author: Bryan Stevenson
Description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.

Title: THE WARMTH OF OTHER SUNS
Author: Isabel Wilkerson
Description: An account of the Great Migration of 1915-70, in which six million African-Americans abandoned the South.

Title: BORN A CRIME
Author: Trevor Noah
Description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”

Title: THE COLOR OF LAW
Author: Richard Rothstein
Description: A case for how the American government abetted racial segregation in metropolitan areas across the country.

Title: STAMPED FROM THE BEGINNING
Author: Ibram X Kendi
Description: Winner of the 2016 National Book Award for nonfiction. A look at anti-Black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history.

Title: THE NEW JIM CROW
Author: Michelle Alexander
Description: A law professor on the “war on drugs” and its role in the disproportionate incarceration of Black men.

Title: WHY ARE ALL THE BLACK KIDS SITTING TOGETHER IN THE CAFETERIA?
Author: Beverly Daniel Tatum
Description: The president emerita of Spelman College examines whether self-segregation is a problem or a coping strategy.

Title: ON TYRANNY
Author: Timothy Snyder
Description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.

Title: FEAR
Author: Bob Woodward
Description: Based on hundreds of hours of interviews with sources, the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist describes debates and decision-making within the Trump White House.

Title: ALEXANDER HAMILTON
Author: Ron Chernow
Description: A biography of the first Treasury secretary and one of the Founding Fathers of the United States. The basis of the Tony Award-winning Broadway musical.

Title: MY GRANDMOTHER'S HANDS
Author: Resmaa Menakem
Description: A therapist who specializes in trauma, body-centered psychotherapy and violence prevention explains racism's effect on the body.

Title: MY OWN WORDS
Author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg with Mary Hartnett and Wendy W. Williams
Description: A collection of articles and speeches by the Supreme Court justice.

Title: SKINNYTASTE MEAL PREP
Author: Gina Homolka with Heather K Jones

Title: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX AND THE HORSE
Author: Charlie Mackesy

Title: ROWLEY JEFFERSON'S AWESOME FRIENDLY ADVENTURE
Author: Jeff Kinney
Description: Roland and Garg the Barbarian embark on a quest to save Roland's mom from the White Warlock.

Title: THE ONE AND ONLY BOB
Author: Katherine Applegate.
Description: In this sequel to "The One and Only Ivan," Bob sets out on a dangerous journey in search of his long-lost sister.

Title: WONDER
Author: R.J. Palacio
Description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school.

Title: DIARY OF AN AWESOME FRIENDLY KID
Author: Jeff Kinney
Description: Greg’s best friend Rowley Jefferson writes his own diary.

Title: THREE KEYS
Author: Kelly Yang
Description: Mia Tang battles racism in this sequel to "Front Desk."

Title: REFUGEE
Author: Alan Gratz
Description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven.

Title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
Author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
Description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen.

Title: THE SILVER ARROW
Author: Lev Grossman
Description: Kate and Tom travel the world saving animals on a magical locomotive.

Title: LITTLE LEADERS
Author: Vashti Harrison
Description: The biographies of 40 African-American women who made a difference.

Title: A WOLF CALLED WANDER
Author: Rosanne Parry.
Description: A young wolf named Swift embarks on a perilous journey.

Title: I PROMISE
Author: LeBron James
Description: An inspirational poem for children by the NBA superstar.

Title: CREEPY PAIR OF UNDERWEAR
Author: Aaron Reynolds.
Description: Jasper Rabbit deals with a pair of glowing underwear that won't go away.

Title: CREEPY CARROTS!
Author: Aaron Reynolds.
Description: A rabbit’s comeuppance.

Title: WILD SYMPHONY
Author: Dan Brown
Description: Through 20 poems, Maestro Mouse introduces us to his musical animal friends.

Title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
Author: Emily Winfield Martin
Description: A celebration of future possibilities.

Title: THE PIGEON HAS TO GO TO SCHOOL!
Author: Mo Willems
Description: Pigeon deals with the anxieties of going to school for the first time.

Title: THE DAY YOU BEGIN
Author: Jacqueline Woodson.
Description: A group of school children embrace their differences.

Title: I AM ENOUGH
Author: Grace ers.
Description: A poetic affirmation of self-esteem.

Title: I AM EVERY GOOD THING
Author: Derrick Barnes
Description: A powerful celebration of Black boyhood.

Title: HAIR LOVE
Author: Matthew A. Cherry.
Description: A father and daughter work together on an extra-special hairstyle.

Title: DOG MAN
Author: Dav Pilkey
Description: A dog’s head is combined with a policeman’s body to create this hybrid supercop hound.

Title: THE TWILIGHT SAGA
Author: Stephenie Meyer
Description: Vampires and werewolves and their intrigues in high school.

Title: HARRY POTTER
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil.

Title: THE LAST KIDS ON EARTH
Author: Max Brallier.
Description: Jack and his friends fight for their lives through the zombie apocalypse.

Title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
Author: and   Jeff Kinney
Description: The travails and challenges of adolescence.

Title: BABY-SITTERS CLUB GRAPHIX
Author: Ann M. Martin; various illustrators
Description: Kristy, Mary Anne, Claudia, Stacey, and Dawn are The Baby-sitters Club.

Title: THE HUNGER GAMES
Author: Suzanne Collins
Description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV.

Title: THE BAD GUYS
Author: Aaron Blabey
Description: Tough animals in suits take on some real villains.

Title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
Author: Rick Riordan
Description: A boy battles mythological monsters.

Title: I SURVIVED
Author: Lauren Tarshis
Description: Youngsters' tales of living through dangerous historical events.

Title: STAMPED
Author: Jason Reynolds and Ibram X. Kendi
Description: An exploration of racism and anti-racism in America.

Title: THE HATE U GIVE
Author: Angie Thomas
Description: A 16-year-old girl sees a police officer kill her friend.

Title: ONE OF US IS LYING
Author: Karen M. McManus
Description: For five students, a detour into detention ends in murder.

Title: GROWN
Author: Tiffany D Jackson
Description: An aspiring singer is taken advantage of by a superstar.

Title: LEGENDBORN
Author: Tracy Deonn
Description: A young girl battles grief and demonic forces on a college campus.

Title: THE LOST BOOK OF THE WHITE
Author: Cassandra Clare and Wesley Chu
Description: Magnus and Alec must retrieve the Book of the White, which is stolen from their apartment.

Title: PUNCHING THE AIR
Author: Ibi Zoboi and Yusef Salaam
Description: Convicted of a crime he didn’t commit and sent to prison, Amal uses the freedom of art to overcome his incarceration.

Title: CEMETERY BOYS
Author: Aiden Thomas
Description: A trans boy determined to prove his gender to his traditional Latinx family summons a ghost who refuses to leave.

Title: CLAP WHEN YOU LAND
Author: Elizabeth Acevedo
Description: Unbeknownst to each other, two sisters meet when their father dies in a plane crash.

Title: HAWK
Author: James Patterson
Description: Ten years after Maximum Ride, a new hero emerges in a postapocalyptic New York City.

Title: THE SANDMAN
Author: Neil Gaiman and Dirk Maggs
Description: Lord Morpheus confronts an array of fictional and historical characters. Read by Riz Ahmed, Kat Dennings, Taron Egerton, James McAvoy, Samantha Morton, et al. 10 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE GUEST LIST
Author: Lucy Foley
Description: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly. Read by Jot Davies, Chloe Massey, Olivia Dowd, et al. 9 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.

Title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
Author: Delia Owens
Description: A young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect. Read by Cassandra Campbell. 12 hours, 12 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE VANISHING HALF
Author: Brit Bennett
Description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge but their fates intertwine. Read by Shayna Small. 11 hours, 34 minutes unabridged.

Title: CRITICAL MASS
Author: Craig Alanson
Description: The 10th book in the Expeditionary Force series. Read by R.C. Bray. 19 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE SILENT WIFE
Author: Karin Slaughter
Description: The 10th book in the Will Trent series. Read by Kathleen Early. 18 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.

Title: PRETTY THINGS
Author: Janelle Brown
Description: The daughter of a con artist and an heiress team up to pull off a big deceit. Read by Julia Whelan, Lauren Fortgang and Hillary Huber. 16 hours, 6 minutes unabridged.

Title: AMERICAN DIRT
Author: Jeanine Cummins
Description: A bookseller flees Mexico for the United States with her son while pursued by the head of a drug cartel. Read by Yareli Arizmendi. 16 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE SILENT PATIENT
Author: Alex Michaelides
Description: A famous painter stops speaking after shooting her husband. Read by Jack Hawkins and Louise Brealey. 8 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE DUTCH HOUSE
Author: Ann Patchett
Description: A sibling relationship is impacted when the family goes from poverty to wealth and back again over the course of many decades. Read by Tom Hanks. 9 hours, 53 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE SUMMER HOUSE
Author: James Patterson and Brendan DuBois
Description: Jeremiah Cook, a veteran and former N.Y.P.D. cop, investigates a mass murder. Read by Ari Fliakos. 10 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE GIVER OF STARS
Author: Jojo Moyes
Description: In Depression-era Kentucky, five women refuse to be cowed by men or convention as they deliver books. Read by Julia Whelan. 13 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.

Title: A PRIVATE CATHEDRAL
Author: James Lee Burke
Description: The 23rd book in the Dave Robicheaux series. Read by Will Patton. 11 hours, 30 minutes unabridged.

Title: 28 SUMMERS
Author: Elin Hilderbrand
Description: A relationship that started in 1993 between Mallory Blessing and Jake McCloud comes to light while she is on her deathbed and his wife runs for president. Read by Erin Bennett. 15 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE THINGS WE CANNOT SAY
Author: Kelly Rimmer
Description: During World War II, a 15-year-old girl’s engagement is imperiled by the Nazi occupation of her village. Read by Ann Marie Gideon and Nancy Peterson. 13 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.

Title: CASTE
Author: Isabel Wilkerson
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today. Read by Robin Miles. 14 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.

Title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH
Author: Mary L Trump
Description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump. Read by the author. 7 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.

Title: UNTAMED
Author: Glennon Doyle
Description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.

Title: LIVE FREE OR DIE
Author: Sean Hannity
Description: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election. Read by the author. 11 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.

Title: BECOMING
Author: Michelle Obama
Description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.

Title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
Author: Ibram X. Kendi
Description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.

Title: BREATH
Author: James Nestor
Description: A re-examination of a basic biological function. Read by the author. 7 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.

Title: WHITE FRAGILITY
Author: Robin DiAngelo
Description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people. Read by Amy Landon. 6 hours, 21 minutes unabridged.

Title: TALKING TO STRANGERS
Author: Malcolm Gladwell
Description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts. Read by the author. 8 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.

Title: FINDING FREEDOM
Author: Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand
Description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s journey from courtship to their decision to step away from their royal lives. Read by Omid Scobie. 10 hours, 29 minutes unabridged.

Title: BORN A CRIME
Author: Trevor Noah
Description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.

Title: EMPIRE OF THE SUMMER MOON
Author: S.C. Gwynne
Description: The story of Quanah Parker, the last chief of the Comanches. Read by David Drummond. 15 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.

Title: THE TRUTHS WE HOLD
Author: Kamala Harris
Description: A memoir by the daughter of immigrants who is now a California senator and the 2020 Democratic candidate for vice president. Read by the author. 9 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.

Title: IT WAS ALL A LIE
Author: Stuart Stevens
Description: The former political campaign strategist evaluates the changes within the Republican Party in the last half-century. Read by Dan John Miller. 5 hours, 37 minutes unabridged.

Title: HOAX
Author: Brian Stelter
Description: The CNN anchor and chief media correspondent examines the inner workings of Fox News and its relationship with President Trump. Read by the author. 12 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.

Title: NEW KID
Author: Jerry Craft
Description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.

Title: GUTS
Author: Raina Telgemeier
Description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.

Title: BABY-SITTERS LITTLE SISTER: KAREN'S ROLLER SKATES
Author: Ann M Martin
Description: After taking a tumble, Karen sets out to get her friends and someone famous to sign her cast.

Title: MARCH: BOOK ONE
Author: John Lewis and Andrew Aydin
Description: Representative John Lewis describes his childhood and the beginning of his involvement in the civil rights movement. The first volume of a trilogy.

Title: THE UMBRELLA ACADEMY: APOCALYPSE SUITE
Author: Gerard Way
Description: When their benefactor suddenly dies, seven children with unusual superpowers reunite to save the world.

Title: THE UMBRELLA ACADEMY: HOTEL OBLIVION
Author: Gerard Way
Description: A few years after Sir Reginald Hargreeves’s death, members of the Umbrella Academy have gone in different directions.

Title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 1
Author: Kohei Horikoshi
Description: In a world full of of people who can develop superpowers, Izuku Midoriya is just a “normal” teenager. Will a chance encounter with a superhero change his fate? Most likely!

Title: PERSEPOLIS
Author: Marjane Satrapi
Description: A memoir of the author’s life from ages 6 to 14 in Iran, during and after its 1979 revolution, depicted through black-and-white comic strip images.

Title: BECOMING BRIANNA
Author: Terri Libenson
Description: The fourth book in the Emmie & Friends series. A middle school girl goes outside her comfort zone.

Title: THE UMBRELLA ACADEMY: DALLAS
Author: Gerard Way
Description: The loss of a beloved mentor, maniacal assassins and a plot to assassinate John F. Kennedy bedevil the trouble-laden team.

Title: STRANGER PLANET
Author: Nathan W Pyle
Description: A sequel to “Strange Planet” that explores the subjects of traditions, nature, emotions and knowledge.

Title: DEMON SLAYER: KIMETSU NO YAIBA, VOL. 1
Author: Koyoharu Gotouge
Description: A young charcoal seller must avenge his family by destroying the demon that slaughtered them.

Title: CRITICAL ROLE, VOX MACHINA: ORIGINS, VOL. 2
Author: Matt Mercer and Jody Houser
Description: A group of would-be superheroes come together in this collected edition.

Title: AMERICAN BORN CHINESE
Author: Gene Luen Yang
Description: When his family moves to the suburbs, Jin Wang wonders why he doesn’t fit in with the “all-American boys” in his new school.

Title: VENUS IN THE BLIND SPOT
Author: Junji Ito
Description: A collection of short horror tales including “The Enigma of Amigara Fault” and an adaptation of Rampo Edogawa’s “Human Chair."

Title: CHILD'S PLAY
Author: Danielle Steel
Description: A prestigious New York lawyer learns that the life she constructed for her children and herself isn't exactly what she thought it was.

Title: PARANOID
Author: Lisa Jackson
Description: Past troubles resurface when a woman who unintentionally killed her half brother 20 years ago prepares for her high school reunion amid a string of potentially connected murders.

Title: GOLDEN IN DEATH
Author: JD Robb
Description: The 50th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas seeks the sender of packages that give off toxic airborne fumes.

Title: OUTFOX
Author: Sandra Brown
Description: F.B.I. Agent Drex Easton has a hunch that the conman Weston Graham is also a serial killer.

Title: THE GUARDIANS
Author: John Grisham
Description: Cullen Post, a lawyer and Episcopal minister, antagonizes some ruthless killers when he takes on a wrongful conviction case.

Title: THE COWBOY'S LADY
Author: Debbie Macomber
Description: Squabbling may lead to romance between a teacher and a rancher living in Cougar Point, Mont. Includes “Small-Town Nanny,” by Lee Tobin McClain.

Title: REDEMPTION
Author: David Baldacci
Description: The fifth book in the Memory Man series. The first man Amos Decker put behind bars asks to have his name cleared.

Title: THE TITANIC SECRET
Author: Clive Cussler and Jack Du Brul
Description: The 11th book in the Isaac Bell series. Dirk Pitt finds a document that brings a mystery from 1911 back to life.

Title: THE CORNWALLS VANISH
Author: James Patterson and Brendan DuBois
Description: An Army intelligence officer must commit a crime or lose her kidnapped husband and daughter.

Title: LABYRINTH
Author: Catherine Coulter
Description: The 23rd book in the F.B.I. Thriller series. Agents Savich and Sherlock wend their way through a maze of lies to get to the bottom of a secret.

Title: THE WARNING
Author: James Patterson and Robison Wells
Description: A small Southern town is not the same after a power-plant accident.

Title: FEELS LIKE FAMILY
Author: Sherryl Woods
Description: The third book in the Sweet Magnolias series. Helen, who is 42 and single, wants to start a family.

Title: DARK ILLUSION
Author: Christine Feehan
Description: The 33rd book in the Carpathian series. A mage and an ancient warrior must stop a threat against all Carpathians.

Title: DEADLY TOUCH
Author: Heather Graham
Description: The 31st book in the Krewe of Hunters series. Raina Hamish has a vision that might help Axel Tiger find a serial killer.

Title: THE OUTSIDER
Author: Stephen King
Description: A detective investigates a seemingly wholesome member of the community when an 11-year-old boy’s body is found.

Title: THE GIRL WHO DRANK THE MOON
Author: Kelly Barnhill

Title: THE ABSOLUTELY TRUE DIARY OF A PART-TIME INDIAN
Author: Sherman Alexie.

Title: THEY BOTH DIE AT THE END
Author: Adam Silvera

Title: THE BOY IN THE STRIPED PAJAMAS
Author: John Boyne

Title: I AM NOT YOUR PERFECT MEXICAN DAUGHTER
Author: Erika L. Sánchez
